Sequence Information.Peptide Name: C2-3 (CATH-2(1-15) analog, synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, avian cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (80%) toCATH-2(1-15)R: 33%, I: 20%, F=K: 13%.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 8739 or 6 resistant E strains (MIC 1-32 ug/ml). Warning: other bacteria not tested.In vitro toxicity: chicken RBC: ~10% hemolysis at 64 ug/ml (slightly hemo.lytic).  At this concentration, ~90% chicken kidney cells survived.
Literature Information.Author: Hao S, Shi W, Chen L, Kong T, Wang B, Chen S, Guo X.2024
Literature Information.Reference: Front Cell Infect Microbiol. 2024 May 15;14:1390934. doi: 10.3389/fcimb.2024.1390934.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: CATH-2-derived antimicrobial peptide inhibits multidrug-resistant Escherichia coli infection in chickens.
